intro: Laplacea semiserrata var. acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved laplacea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are finely serrated along the edges. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for dry, arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and rockeries.
